raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has reported bilateral knee pain for five years, with worsening symptoms over the past two years. Radiographic imaging revealed grade 4 advanced osteoarthritis. Treatment with NSAIDs and muscle relaxants for one month provided mild symptomatic relief. The patient is currently undergoing physiotherapy and will be reassessed in two weeks.

extraction_reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain, a chief complaint that has been ongoing for five years and worsening over the past two years. The diagnosis of grade 4 osteoarthritis is supported by radiographic imaging, corresponding to ICD-10 code M17.0 for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The patient has been treated with NSAIDs and muscle relaxants, which provided mild relief. Current management includes physiotherapy, and the plan is to continue this with a follow-up assessment in two weeks.
